title: Is Harry Potter stronger than Percy Jackson? - Quora

response.answer_text: Percy is infinitely more powerful than Harry. “And I charged. The first skeleton fired. Time slowed down. I won't say I could see the bullet, but I could feel it's path, the way I could feel water currents in the ocean. I deflected it off the edge of my blade and kept charging.”- The Titan's Curse, pg 168 Rick Riordan. “I used my wand this time, catching his blade in the crook of ivory and channeling a burst of magic straight up his arm. The air between us flashed and crackled. Camper boy stumbled back. Blue sparks of sorcery popped around him, as if my spell didn't know quite what to do with him.”- The Son of Sobek, loc 149, Rick Riordan. “Jason called down another lightning strike, but Ephialtes caught it on his spear and deflected the blast, melting a life sized plastic cow.”- The Mark of Athena, pg 527, Rick Riordan. In the first quote, Percy deflected a bullet. Using in canon values, the bullet would move at ~759 m/s. If Percy was 2 meters away, he would have around 0.001 seconds to react. In the second quote, Carter Kane uses a spell on Percy, and it does nothing. In the third quote, a giant that was not noted to be faster than Percy and Jason deflected lightning. Since it said he caught it, we an assume that Ephialtes moved AFTER the lightning started moving. Percy scales to Jason, who survived more energy than a Tomahawk middle with a conventional warhead. “The explosion was hotter than the giant's breath, blinding Jason with golden light. The force knocked him off his feet and squeezed the breath out of him. When he regained focus, he was sitting at the rim of a crater. Enceladus stood at the other side, staggering and confused. The javelin's destruction had released so much energy, it had blasted a perfect cone-shaped pit 30 feet deep, fusing the dirt and rock into a slick glassy substance.”- The Lost Hero, pg 463, Rick Riordan. Percy and Jason are rough physical equals. Jason has lightning timing. “Jason swung at the first spirit. His blade passed through it, and the creature’s smokey form disintigrated. The other let loose a bolt of lightning, but Jason’s blade absorbed the charge.”- The Lost Hero, pg 23, Rick Riordan. Jason had just cut down another spirit, so he would have to move AFTER the second spirit shot the lightning bolt. At a high end distance, the spirit would be ~21 meters away. It was likely, close, but whatever. Lightning travels at 89408 meters per second on average. 21/89408 is 0.0002 seconds. Jason had that much time to react. Again, this is likely a low end, and the spirits, were likely closer to him. Percy kept up with Jason in a sword fight when he was not cursed or waterboosted. And Percy and Jason have mountain level strength. “Before they could get very far, Enceladus slammed his spear against the ground. The entire mountain shook.”- The Lost Hero, pg 452, Rick Riordan. Jason raised his javelin to block the giant's next strike-a big mistake. Don't fight force with force, a voice chided him-the wolf Lupa, who'd told him that long ago. He managed to deflect the spear, but it grazed his shoulder, and his arm went numb.”-The Lost Hero, pg 461, Rick Riordan. And one more feat for Percy. “I met Kronos’s first strike with Riptide. The impact shook the entire bridge.” That was the Williamsburg bridge, which is over a kilometer long. So we can see from these quotes that Percy is much stronger and faster than Harry, in addition to being magic resistant. Therefore, Percy can dodge the spells and punch Harry in the face, breaking his neck. Or Percy can cleave him in half. Meanwhile, Harry's spell hit Percy harmlessly, and he can't do anything about it. And before you say “muh sword of Gryffindor,” Harry has zero skill with a sword. He can barely swing it. So, in conclusion, Percy stomps with minimal use of powers. And if Harry gets here Hallows, Percy gets the Curse of Achilles and the Nemian lion cloak, making him completely invincible, as well as the Legion Eagle staff, which shoots lightning. Oh, and he can host and Egyptian goddess, which enhances his strength even further, and gives him a combat avatar. Percy is stronger and faster than Harry physically, and is more powerful. Harry cannot compare to Percy.
